result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid from bail on deposit. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The court waived non-mandatory fees due to indigency.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Restitution set at zero.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Robert Siesennop

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Concurrent with any other sentence, with credit for 1 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid from bail on deposit.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED non-mandatory fees due to indigency. 
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Restitution set at ZERO. 

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop in court with via zoom, Attorney Jeffrey John Ek.  Defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.   

Case proceeded to sentencing. 

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Elements of Criminal Offenses

State's offer
Letters on behalf of defendant, filed

Attorney Jeffrey John Ek in court, defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to the court from defense counsel dated May 10, 2021 as to discovery demand - received

Defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop in court with Attorney Jeffrey John Ek; both appear by video.  Defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Kohl's Department Store-Milwaukee County
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop in court with attorney Jeffrey John Ek.  Defendant Joseph Robert Siesennop in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph Robert Siesennop appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to Court from defense counsel, filed
